title: USM Sétif
text:
Union Sportive Madinet Sétif (), known as USM Sétif or simply USMS for short, is an Algerian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club located in <a href="S%C3%A9tif">Sétif</a>, <a href="Algeria">Algeria</a>. The club was founded in 1933 and its colors are garnet and white. Their home stadium, <a href="Stade%208%20Mai%201945">Stade 8 Mai 1945</a>, has a capacity of 18,000 spectators. The club is currently playing in the <a href="Inter-R%C3%A9gions%20Division">Inter-Régions Division</a>.
History.
The club was founded in 1933 under the name of Union Sportive Musulmane de Sétif, officially declared under the name of Union Sportive Franco-Musulmane de Sétif it's the oldest of Sétif. The club was champion of the Constantine League twice in 1946 and 1951. After independence in 1962, the club played in <a href="Algerian%20Ligue%20Professionnelle%201">first division</a> during two seasons 1973-74 and 1974-75.
The club was also named Ittihad Riadhi Baladiat Sétif between the 70s and the 80s.
In 2005, USM Sétif reached the final of the <a href="Algerian%20Cup">Algerian Cup</a> for the first time in the club's history. However, in the final, they lost 1–0 against <a href="ASO%20Chlef">ASO Chlef</a>.
